intro: Xolisma brittonii, commonly known as the brittlestem flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Linaceae family, which includes other species such as common flax. This plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Xolisma brittonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
